paper_abstract: A boosted tree classifier is proposed to segment machine printed, handwritten and overlapping text from documents with handwritten annotations. Each node of the tree-structured classifier is a binary weak learner. Unlike a standard decision tree (DT) which only considers a subset of training data at each node and is susceptible to over-fitting, we boost the tree using all available training data at each node with different weights. The proposed method is evaluated on a set of machine-printed documents which have been annotated by multiple writers in an office/collaborative environment. The experimental results show that the proposed algorithm outperforms other methods on an imbalanced data set. (C) 2011 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Using a boosted tree classifier for text segmentation in hand-annotated documents
